body: @yegor256 please pay attention to this issue ([par.21](http://at.teamed.io/policy.html#21))

The job [#1204](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/1204) assigned to @paulodamaso[/z](https://www.0crat.com/u/paulodamaso), here is [why](https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/2568e19c-566e-422a-aaa3-3814a3f02e1e); the budget is 30 minutes, see [§4](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#4); please, read [§8](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#8) and [§9](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#9); if the task is not clear, read [this](http://www.yegor256.com/2015/02/16/it-is-not-a-school.html) and [this](http://www.yegor256.com/2015/01/15/how-to-cut-corners.html); there will be no monetary reward for this job

issue.title: For #1204: Add support to lock and unlock

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
For #1204:
- Added `lock`, `unlock` and `isLocked` methods to `Issue` interface;
- Added test for lock and unlock methods
- Left todo

issue.title: Issue.java:61-64: Implement Lock and unlock features to...

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
The puzzle `1204-0dae0ae7` from #1204 has to be resolved: 

https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/blob/cf87980922e40e0504d8cf55a9fd1596e8975283/src/main/java/com/jcabi/github/Issue.java#L61-L64

The puzzle was created by Paulo Lobo on 24-Dec-18. 

  

If you have any technical questions, don't ask me, submit new tickets instead. The task will be \"done\" when the problem is fixed and the text of the puzzle is _removed_ from the source code. Here is more about [PDD](http://www.yegor256.com/2009/03/04/pdd.html) and [about me](http://www.yegor256.com/2017/04/05/pdd-in-action.html).

body: @cvrebert the puzzle [#1462](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/1462) is still not solved.
